setting.name: uri
setting.description: The AOR for this queue. This attribute is also the index attribute for this object class.

setting.name: name
setting.description: A short descriptive name for this queue. Used primarily for display purposes.

setting.name: acd-scheme
setting.label: Call routing scheme
setting.description: The ACD call routing scheme that will be employed on this queue.

setting.name: max-ring-delay
setting.label: Maximum ring delay
setting.description: The maximum time, in seconds, that the queue will allow an agent station to ring before a ring-no-answer condition is declared and the call is rerouted.

setting.name: max-queue-depth
setting.label: Maximum queue length
setting.description: The maximum number of calls that are allowed to wait in this queue. If a call arrives at this queue and the resulting call count exceeds this number, then an overflow condition for this queue will be triggered. A value of -1 disables this limit check.

setting.name: max-wait-time
setting.label: Maximum wait time
setting.description: The maximum time, in seconds, that a call can reside in a queue. When a waiting call exceeds this time limit, an overflow condition for this queue will be triggered. A value of zero disables timeouts.

setting.name: fifo-overflow
setting.label: FIFO overflow
setting.description: If set, then upon an overflow condition, a FIFO scheme will be employed in order to determine which call will be moved to the configured overflow-queue. If not set, then a LIFO scheme will be employed.

setting.name: overflow-queue
setting.label: Overflow queue
setting.description: This is the queue that, upon an overflow condition, calls will be transferred to. If no ACD Queue is specified, the call will be dropped.

setting.name: answer-mode
setting.label: Answer mode
setting.description: If set to Immediate, the call will be answered immediately upon arriving at this queue and the configured welcome-audio file will be played to the caller. Once the audio has completed, the queue will then attempt to route the call. If set to Deferred, the queue will first attempt to route the call. If it is unable to immediately route the call, it will then be answered. If set to Never, the call will not be answered while on this queue other than when actually connecting to an agent.

setting.name: barge-in
setting.label: Barge in
setting.description: If set, the welcome audio will be terminated early, should an agent become available while it is being played.

setting.name: call-connect-scheme
setting.label: Call connecting scheme
setting.description: This specifies the internal scheme that is used to connect an incoming caller to an agent. Depending on which scheme is selected, certain call features such as Agent Conferencing and Session Recording might not be available.

setting.name: welcome-audio
setting.label: Welcome audio
setting.description: The name of an acd-audio object identifier that will be used to source audio to callers if the immediate-answer parameter is set to TRUE. If no file is specified, then silence will be played.

setting.name: queue-audio
setting.label: Queue audio
setting.description: The name of an acd-audio object that will be used to source audio repeatedly to the caller until the queue either routes the call to an agent or to another queue. The repeat interval is specified by Audio interval.

setting.name: background-audio
setting.label: Background audio
setting.description: The name of an acd-audio object that will be used to source audio repeatedly to the caller between intervals of playing the queue audio. If no file is specified, then a confirmation tone will be played every 15 seconds.

setting.name: queue-audio-interval
setting.label: Audio interval
setting.description: The interval, in seconds, to wait before repeating play of the specified Queue audio.

setting.name: call-termination-audio
setting.label: Call termination audio
setting.description: The name of an acd-audio object that will be used to source audio to the caller when it has been determined that the call must be terminated. Once the audio has completed, the call will be dropped. If no audio is specified, then a busy tone will be played prior to terminating the call. The duration of the busy tone is specified by the termination-tone-duration attribute.

setting.name: termination-tone-duration
setting.label: Termination tone duration
setting.description: The duration, in seconds, that the termination tone (busy tone) is to be played if no call-termination-audio is specified and the call is to be dropped by the queue. A value of zero indicates that no tone is to be played prior to dropping the call.

setting.name: acd-agent-list
setting.description: The list of ACD Agents that are assigned to this queue. The queue will attempt to route calls that it is processing to one or more of the listed agents based upon the agent availability and the queue routing policy. The order of agents in the list is relevant in respect to call routing when the call routing scheme for this queue is set to Linear.
